content:
In using the FFI example I noticed that if I include and use additional standard libraries, such as chrono then the linker fails in GitHub CI with the error message ld.lld: error: undefined symbol: std::chrono::_V2::system_clock::now()

Meanwhile, it works on my laptop. I tried to change the lakefile.lean provided in the FFI example to be more specific about the compiler (g++, clang++) and to explicitly pass additional argument (such as -lstdc++) but to no effect.

Any suggestion as to what is going on, how to fix this, or how to investigate this further would be appreciated.
I should add: this is not just for chrono, it is also true of basic libraries such as ios_base.
John Tristan has marked this topic as resolved.
